properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-31T18:21:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-31T02:21:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0529835742.2021
Area: Fraser Canyon - south including Lytton
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected late Sunday. Winds are forecast to increase to 70 km/h near the Richardson Mountains late Sunday. This will bring blizzard conditions to the region which will likely persist until Monday afternoon. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-31T14:57:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-30T22:58:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0778889152.2021
Area: Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. A Pacific frontal system is giving snow heavy at times to southern sections of Fraser Canyon. Total snow accumulation up to 15 cm can be expected near Boston Bar before the snow changes to rain near noon Sunday. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-31T18:38:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-31T02:39:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2218142204.2021
Area: Fraser Canyon - south including Lytton
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A series of Pacific weather systems will bring snow to the mountain parks regions, specifically Highway 93. Snow is expected to start on Sunday with 25 to 30 cm of snow expected by Monday morning. Another Pacific system will bring more snow beginning Monday overnight with a further 10 to 20 cm of snow expected by Tuesday evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-31T14:29:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-30T22:30:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1315079114.2021
Area: Highway 93 - Lake Louise to Saskatchewan River Crossing, Highway 93 - Jasper to Saskatchewan River Crossing
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. Stagnant weather conditions under a ridge of high pressure are causing pollutants to build up with time. The poor air quality is expected to improve by Monday morning. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. People with lung diseases, such as asthma and COPD, can be particularly sensitive to air pollution. They will generally experience more serious health effects at lower levels. Pollution can aggravate their diseases, leading to increased medication use, doctor and emergency room visits, and hospital visits. For more information please visit Alberta Health Services at www.albertahealthservices.ca/news/air.aspx. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2021-01-31T11:17:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, Alberta Environment and Parks, Alberta Health, Alberta Health Services, 2021-01-30T19:18:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1183536002.2021
